Speaker: Customer
Text: Tech support help from call center experts, solving your tech problem scene one, troubleshooting hardware issue.

Speaker: Agent
Text: Thank you for calling single step digital. My name is Kimberly. How may I assist you?

Speaker: Customer
Text: Hi, I'm having trouble with my internet connection. It keeps dropping out and it's driving me crazy.

Speaker: Agent
Text: I'm so sorry to hear that. Let's see if we can troubleshoot the issue.

Speaker: Agent
Text: First, can you tell me what kind of modem or router you have?

Speaker: Customer
Text: It's a net enforcer. Hold on. Let me check the number.

Speaker: Customer
Text: It's TD 2800.

Speaker: Agent
Text: Okay, Model TD 2800. Let's start by resetting the modem.

Speaker: Agent
Text: Can you unplug it from the power source and wait for 30 seconds, then plug it back in and turn it on?

Speaker: Customer
Text: Yes, I've already done that several times and it hasn't helped.

Speaker: Agent
Text: I understand how frustrating this can be. Let's try something else.

Speaker: Agent
Text: Can you try connecting your computer directly to the modem with an ethernet cable and see if you're able to get a stable internet connection that way?

Speaker: Customer
Text: Okay, I'll try that, but it was plugged in before.

Speaker: Agent
Text: Oh, I see. Well, let's give it a try and see what happens.

Speaker: Customer
Text: It's actually working now. I can't believe it.

Speaker: Agent
Text: I'm glad to hear that. Do you want to try to access a website just to make sure?

Speaker: Customer
Text: Yeah, that's a good idea. Hold on.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Looking good. Yup. It works fine.

Speaker: Agent
Text: Great. Is there anything else I can assist you with?

Speaker: Customer
Text: No, that's all. I'm so glad we got that resolved. Thanks for your help.

Speaker: Agent
Text: My pleasure. Thank you for calling single step digital. Goodbye.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Scene two. Thank you for calling single step digital. My name is Ryan. How may I assist you?

Speaker: Customer
Text: Hi there. I'm having trouble with my computer. It keeps freezing up and I can't get anything done.

Speaker: Customer
Text: I'm very sorry to hear that. Let's see if we can troubleshoot the issue.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Could you tell me which version of Windows you're using?

Speaker: Customer
Text: It's Windows 10.

Speaker: Customer
Text: All right. Let's try running a system file checker to see if there are any corrupted files that need to be repaired. Can you open the command prompt as an administrator?

Speaker: Customer
Text: No, I don't know how to do that.

Speaker: Customer
Text: That's okay. I can guide you through the steps.

Speaker: Customer
Text: First, type command prompt into the search bar in the bottom left corner of your screen.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Right click on it and select run as administrator.

Speaker: Customer
Text: All right. I seem to have done that.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Now, type sfc slash scan now and press enter. This will scan your system files and repair any corrupted files that it finds.

Speaker: Customer
Text: How long is this going to take? I have a lot of work to do.

Speaker: Customer
Text: It shouldn't take too long. It depends on the size of your hard drive and the number of files that need to be scanned.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Hey, it's actually working now. That was fast. Thank you so much for your help.

Speaker: Customer
Text: You're welcome. Is there anything else I can help you with today?

Speaker: Customer
Text: No, that's all. Thanks again.

Speaker: Customer
Text: You're very welcome. Goodbye.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Scene three.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Thank you for calling single step digital. My name is Stephanie. How may I assist you?

Speaker: Customer
Text: Hi, my printer is acting up again. I've tried everything I can think of and I'm about ready to

Speaker: Customer
Text: throw it out the window. I'm so sorry to hear that. Please don't throw it out the window. Let's see if we can troubleshoot the issue. Could you please tell me what kind of printer you have?

Speaker: Customer
Text: It's again and pixelator CW 4000.

Speaker: Customer
Text: All right. Let's start by checking the ink levels. Can you go to your printer settings and see

Speaker: Customer
Text: if any of the ink cartridges are low or empty? Yes. I've already checked that. The ink levels are

Speaker: Customer
Text: fine. That's not the issue. I see. Let's try something else then. Have you tried resetting the printer to its default settings? No, I haven't. How do I do that?

Speaker: Customer
Text: First, turn off the printer and unplug it from the power source. Then, hold down the power button for 15 seconds. After that, plug the printer back in and turn it on again.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Okay. I'll try that. Let's give it a minute or so.

Speaker: Customer
Text: It's making some noises. That might be a good sign. Okay. Wait. I hear some paper moving.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Yes. Hold on. It's actually printing again. I can't believe it.

Speaker: Customer
Text: I'm so happy to hear that. Is there anything else I can assist you with?

Speaker: Customer
Text: No. That's all. Thank you so much for your help. I really thought my printer had died.

Speaker: Customer
Text: I am so glad we brought your printer back to life. Don't hesitate to reach out to us if you have any further issues in the future. What's your name again? My name is Stephanie.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Okay. Stephanie. Thanks again. You're welcome. Sir. Have a nice day. Goodbye.

Speaker: Customer
Text: Remember to watch our other roleplay videos.
